title: Need help with my userChrome.css and window controls
content:
I'm trying to get Firefox to obey my window control order. For me, the window controls are on the left with the order of Close, Maximize, Minimize. But Firefox does not like that and puts it like macOS with Close, Minimize, Maximize.

So I got this going 

#TabsToolbar {   direction: ltr; }  #tabbrowser-tabs {   direction: ltr; }  .titlebar-buttonbox {   display: flex; }  .titlebar-min {   order: 2; }  .titlebar-max {   order: 1; }

And it works well. But here is the problem, when the window becomes Maximized, the order changes to Maximize, Close, Minimize, as seen here in the photo. Anyone got some advice?

title: "This file is not commonly downloaded" for zip files in firefox but not in chrome or edge
content:
So since I was making a website for the first time, I registered a new domain name with the extension ".ml"(example something.ml) since I get it for free. Now, I hosted this domain on a well know server provider and I have an HTML code which makes user download a zip file containing some png images when clicked on a button. When I download the zip file on chrome, it works fine. But on Firefox, it says "This file is not commonly downloaded." I checked several hours but have failed to solve this issue which doesn't arrise in chrome or edge. Is it because of extension ".ml"?

The code I used for sending the zip file was ``` $zip = new ZipArchive(); $zip->open("$zipcreated"); $sendfolder = "$zipcreated"; header('Content-type: application/zip'); header('Content-Description: File Transfer'); header("Content-Disposition: attachment; filename=$sendfolder"); header('Expires: 0'); header('Cache-Control: must-revalidate'); header('Pragma: public'); $size = filesize($sendfolder); header('Content-Length: ' . filesize("$sendfolder")); ob_clean(); readfile($sendfolder); ``` I tried using missingpadlock website and other checks but have failed to understand where the problem lies. Any help would be greatly appreciated!
creator: kbgedia24

title: DISABLE HTTPS only mode & use HTTP ONLY
content:
Since the Firefox developers are acting like Microsoft (this is MY computer not yours so my rules, my choices) & refusing to allow HTTP connections & always forcing HTTPS I have switched to Opera.

When I type in a URL, I expect any browser to obey the user's request & allow it without intervention but NOT Firefox because they dictate what I can & can't do on my own computer, just like Microsoft.

I also noticed that Firefox is broken for EVERY speedtest site out there. No matter which speedtest site I go to, Firefox tests at 200-327 Mbps. I test random times all throughout the day/night & the tests ALWAYS show less than my actual speed. When I immediately test on the same site with Opera, my speeds are 100% accurate (500 Mbps), so that PROVES Firefox is garbage & needs serious redevelopment.

When I called my ISP to complain about my low speeds, they investigated, & the engineers informed me that my browser was at fault. They told me that any browser that interferes with normal use & causes these kinds of problems needs to be BANNED planet wide FOREVER. Once I switched to Opera, no more issues & everything operates much better. If the developers CAN'T or WON'T fix these issues, then I agree with the engineers.

The engineers explained to me that just because I have all IPV6 traffic inbound/outbound BLOCKED permanently on my computer & firewall & ONLY allow/use IPV4, it has no bearing on using ANY browser. They told me to contact CIRA Canadian Internet Registration Authority at https://performance.cira.ca/ & their engineers also confirmed that Firefox was to blame & seriously broken.

title: Can I show top-level domains such as .com .org etc... in the shortcuts that appear in the new tab?
content:
Can I show top-level domains such as .com .org etc... in the shortcuts that appear in the new tab?

In previous versions, for example, it would show "Google.com", but now it just shows "Google".

This is fine for large corporate websites like Google, YouTube, Facebook. but for smaller ones, or if the domain itself is included in the site name, it can be confusing.

title: Sound in Firefox Browser
content:
Recently, I began having sound problems with Firefox -- doesn't matter what I am watching: a stream, a youtube video, anything.....suddenly the video will stop as if buffering (I see the three dots)...video will then resume, but without sound.

I have run diagnostics on my computer sound and everything is fine....I've even troubleshooted while affected video is soundless....I get sound through my sound devices....yet nothing through firefox. The only solution is close the brower and return to target site....however, that is only temporary as the loss of volume will occur again within 5-10 minutes.

The other solution (which lasts a little longer) is to uninstall and reinstall the browser. I have tested other browsers and this does not happen. I am at a loss.

title: My Firefox profile is blocking GitHub.com!
content:
Hello.

Firefox prevents me from opening the following URL, citing Google Safe Browsing advisory:

Google, however, denies having issued any recommendation to block.

I have noticed that the problem has something to do with my own profile. The problem doesn't appear under the following circumstances:

  • I start Firefox with a new profile

I tried manually disabling all my add-ons, but even with all of them disabled, I can still reproduce the problem.

Any idea what could be wrong with my setup?
